publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2139# Cathy Peattie: BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy—That the Parliament notes the central role of the BBC in the promotion of Scottish culture and society and coverage of Scottish current affairs and its contribution to Scottish creative industries and the Scottish economy; expresses concern at the recent announcement by BBC's Director-General, Mark Thompson, and subsequently by the Controller of BBC Scotland, Ken McQuarrie, regarding restructuring, cutbacks and outsourcing and, in particular, the implications of this announcement for Scotland, and believes that the BBC’s historic obligation to provide high-quality public service broadcasting and its contribution to the economic and cultural life of Scotland should be enhanced, not diminished.

S2M-2139# Cathy Peattie: BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy—That the Parliament notes the central role of the BBC in the promotion of Scottish culture and society and coverage of Scottish current affairs and its contribution to Scottish creative industries and the Scottish economy; expresses concern at the recent announcement by BBC’s Director-General, Mark Thompson, and subsequently by the Controller of BBC Scotland, Ken McQuarrie, regarding restructuring, cutbacks and outsourcing and, in particular, the implications of this announcement for Scotland, and believes that the BBC’s historic obligation to provide high-quality public service broadcasting and its contribution to the economic and cultural life of Scotland should be enhanced, not diminished. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2139# BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy (lodged on 9 December 2004) Robert Brown*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mike Pringle*

S2M-2139# BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy (lodged on 9 December 2004) Chris Ballance*, Mark Ballard*, Cathie Craigie*, Frances Curran*, Patrick Harvie*, Richard Lochhead*, Elaine Smith*, Jackie Baillie*, Eleanor Scott*, Colin Fox*, Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*, Christine Grahame*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Karen Gillon*, Alex Neil*, Brian Adam*, Marlyn Glen*
S2M-2139# BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy (lodged on 9 December 2004) Helen Eadie*, Rob Gibson*, Robin Harper*, Pauline McNeill*, Carolyn Leckie*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Bill Butler*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-2139# BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy (lodged on 9 December 2004) Trish Godman*, Mike Watson*
S2M-2139# BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy (lodged on 9 December 2004) Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2139# BBC, Scottish Culture and Economy (lodged on 9 December 2004) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, John Swinburne*
